citation.fr: [{\"type\": \"dataset\", \"id\": \"ca.cioos_c113d7a8-6a46-46fc-b49c-a4e69afedfbc\", \"author\": [{\"given\": \"Katie\", \"family\": \"Campbell\"}, {\"given\": \"Carrie\", \"family\": \"Weekes\"}, {\"given\": \"Wiley\", \"family\": \"Evans\"}, {\"given\": \"Iria\", \"family\": \"Gimenez\"}, {\"given\": \"Burke\", \"family\": \"Hales\"}], \"issued\": [{\"date-parts\": [\"2023\", \"10\", \"18\"]}], \"abstract\": \"L'analyseur tCO2/pCO2 Burke-o-Lator (BoL) mesure le carbone inorganique dissous total (TCO2) et la pression partielle du dioxyde de carbone (pCO2) \u00e0 la fois en continu \u00e0 partir d'un flux d'eau de mer \u00e0 \u00e9coulement continu et \u00e0 partir d'eau de mer collect\u00e9e dans des flacons d'\u00e9chantillons distincts. L'Institut Hakai utilise des instruments BoL dans des installations c\u00f4ti\u00e8res de la c\u00f4te de la Colombie-Britannique, et nos analyses d'\u00e9chantillons discrets des param\u00e8tres du syst\u00e8me de carbonate marin d'eau de mer sont effectu\u00e9es \u00e0 l'aide de cet instrument. Ce protocole s'inspire largement de celui d\u00e9velopp\u00e9 par le groupe CO2 de l'Oregon State University (OSU), mais repr\u00e9sente une \u00e9volution significative en termes de pr\u00e9cision et de rigueur. Ce protocole est destin\u00e9 aux utilisateurs du BoL qui connaissent le fonctionnement et le d\u00e9pannage du BoL et du logiciel de contr\u00f4le, ainsi que la s\u00e9curit\u00e9 g\u00e9n\u00e9rale des laboratoires. Si l'utilisateur n'est pas familiaris\u00e9 avec les solutions chimiques et les r\u00e9actifs utilis\u00e9s dans les proc\u00e9dures suivantes, nous lui recommandons de lire les fiches de donn\u00e9es de s\u00e9curit\u00e9 et les plans de contr\u00f4le de l'exposition appropri\u00e9s. \n\nCitez Pocock, K., C. Weekes, W. Evans, I. Gimenez et B. Hales. (2023). Protocoles d'analyse d'\u00e9chantillons discrets de l'analyseur Burke-o-Lator tCO2/pCO2 de l'Institut Hakai (v2.0). https://doi.org/10.21966/1.521066\", \"edition-date\": \"\", \"publisher\": \"Hakai Institute\", \"title\": \"Protocoles d'analyse d'\u00e9chantillons discrets de l'analyseur Burke-o-lator tCO2/pCO2 de l'Institut Hakai\", \"version\": \"2.0\", \"DOI\": \"10.21966/1.521066\", \"language\": \"fr\", \"URL\": \"https://catalogue.hakai.org/dataset/ca-cioos_c113d7a8-6a46-46fc-b49c-a4e69afedfbc?local=fr\"}]
citation.en: [{\"type\": \"dataset\", \"id\": \"ca.cioos_c113d7a8-6a46-46fc-b49c-a4e69afedfbc\", \"author\": [{\"given\": \"Katie\", \"family\": \"Campbell\"}, {\"given\": \"Carrie\", \"family\": \"Weekes\"}, {\"given\": \"Wiley\", \"family\": \"Evans\"}, {\"given\": \"Iria\", \"family\": \"Gimenez\"}, {\"given\": \"Burke\", \"family\": \"Hales\"}], \"issued\": [{\"date-parts\": [\"2023\", \"10\", \"18\"]}], \"abstract\": \"The Burke-o-Lator (BoL) TCO2/pCO2 analyzer measures total dissolved inorganic carbon (TCO2) and carbon dioxide partial pressure (pCO2) both continuously from a flow-through seawater stream and from seawater collected in discrete sample bottles. The Hakai Institute operates BoL instruments at shore-side facilities on the British Columbia coast, and our discrete sample analyses of seawater marine carbonate system parameters are conducted using this instrument. This protocol follows heavily from that developed in the Oregon State University (OSU) CO2 Group, but represents a significant evolution in precision and rigor. This protocol is intended for BoL users that are familiar with the operation and troubleshooting of the BoL and control software, as well as general lab safety. If the user is unfamiliar with any of the chemical solutions and reagents used in the following procedures, we recommend they read the appropriate safety data sheets and exposure control plans. \n\nCite as: Pocock, K., C. Weekes, W. Evans, I. Gimenez, and B. Hales. (2023). Hakai Institute\u2019s Burke-o-Lator TCO2/pCO2 Analyzer Discrete Sample Analysis Protocols (v2.0). https://doi.org/10.21966/1.521066\", \"edition-date\": \"\", \"publisher\": \"Hakai Institute\", \"title\": \"Hakai Institute\u2019s Burke-o-Lator TCO2/pCO2 Analyzer Discrete Sample Analysis Protocols\", \"version\": \"2.0\", \"DOI\": \"10.21966/1.521066\", \"language\": \"en\", \"URL\": \"https://catalogue.hakai.org/dataset/ca-cioos_c113d7a8-6a46-46fc-b49c-a4e69afedfbc?local=en\"}]

      <mri:abstract xsi:type="lan:PT_FreeText_PropertyType">
        <gco:CharacterString>The Burke-o-Lator (BoL) TCO2/pCO2 analyzer measures total dissolved inorganic carbon (TCO2) and carbon dioxide partial pressure (pCO2) both continuously from a flow-through seawater stream and from seawater collected in discrete sample bottles. The Hakai Institute operates BoL instruments at shore-side facilities on the British Columbia coast, and our discrete sample analyses of seawater marine carbonate system parameters are conducted using this instrument. This protocol follows heavily from that developed in the Oregon State University (OSU) CO2 Group, but represents a significant evolution in precision and rigor. This protocol is intended for BoL users that are familiar with the operation and troubleshooting of the BoL and control software, as well as general lab safety. If the user is unfamiliar with any of the chemical solutions and reagents used in the following procedures, we recommend they read the appropriate safety data sheets and exposure control plans. 

Cite as: Pocock, K., C. Weekes, W. Evans, I. Gimenez, and B. Hales. (2023). Hakai Institutes Burke-o-Lator TCO2/pCO2 Analyzer Discrete Sample Analysis Protocols (v2.0). https://doi.org/10.21966/1.521066</gco:CharacterString>

            <lan:LocalisedCharacterString locale="#fr">L'analyseur tCO2/pCO2 Burke-o-Lator (BoL) mesure le carbone inorganique dissous total (TCO2) et la pression partielle du dioxyde de carbone (pCO2)  la fois en continu  partir d'un flux d'eau de mer  coulement continu et  partir d'eau de mer collecte dans des flacons d'chantillons distincts. L'Institut Hakai utilise des instruments BoL dans des installations ctires de la cte de la Colombie-Britannique, et nos analyses d'chantillons discrets des paramtres du systme de carbonate marin d'eau de mer sont effectues  l'aide de cet instrument. Ce protocole s'inspire largement de celui dvelopp par le groupe CO2 de l'Oregon State University (OSU), mais reprsente une volution significative en termes de prcision et de rigueur. Ce protocole est destin aux utilisateurs du BoL qui connaissent le fonctionnement et le dpannage du BoL et du logiciel de contrle, ainsi que la scurit gnrale des laboratoires. Si l'utilisateur n'est pas familiaris avec les solutions chimiques et les ractifs utiliss dans les procdures suivantes, nous lui recommandons de lire les fiches de donnes de scurit et les plans de contrle de l'exposition appropris. 

Citez Pocock, K., C. Weekes, W. Evans, I. Gimenez et B. Hales. (2023). Protocoles d'analyse d'chantillons discrets de l'analyseur Burke-o-Lator tCO2/pCO2 de l'Institut Hakai (v2.0). https://doi.org/10.21966/1.521066</lan:LocalisedCharacterString>
          </lan:textGroup>

name: ca-cioos_c113d7a8-6a46-46fc-b49c-a4e69afedfbc
notes:
The Burke-o-Lator (BoL) TCO2/pCO2 analyzer measures total dissolved inorganic carbon (TCO2) and carbon dioxide partial pressure (pCO2) both continuously from a flow-through seawater stream and from seawater collected in discrete sample bottles. The Hakai Institute operates BoL instruments at shore-side facilities on the British Columbia coast, and our discrete sample analyses of seawater marine carbonate system parameters are conducted using this instrument. This protocol follows heavily from that developed in the Oregon State University (OSU) CO2 Group, but represents a significant evolution in precision and rigor. This protocol is intended for BoL users that are familiar with the operation and troubleshooting of the BoL and control software, as well as general lab safety. If the user is unfamiliar with any of the chemical solutions and reagents used in the following procedures, we recommend they read the appropriate safety data sheets and exposure control plans. 

Cite as: Pocock, K., C. Weekes, W. Evans, I. Gimenez, and B. Hales. (2023). Hakai Institutes Burke-o-Lator TCO2/pCO2 Analyzer Discrete Sample Analysis Protocols (v2.0). https://doi.org/10.21966/1.521066
